item.title: Main Cargo Air Distribution Riser Shutoff Valves

remarks.para: One may be inoperative closed provided:

numlitem.para: Corresponding zone trim air modulating valve is deactivated closed, and
Operation is limited to one pack.

note.para: In event of operating pack failure, turn on remaining pack.

numlitem.para: Limit altitude to FL350 or below.

note.para: In event of operating pack failure, turn on remaining pack.

numlitem.para: Limit flight altitude to FL350 or below.

placard.para: Placard the Air Conditioning Pack Selector "OPERATION LIMITED TO ONE PACK".
Placard respective Cabin Temp Selector "FWD OR AFT MAIN CARGO S/O VALVE CLOSED" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure applicable Main Cargo Shutoff Valve closed per following procedure.
Verify that the Air Conditioning Pack selector, on the P5 panel, is in the OFF position. Verify that the PACK OFF Light is on. Put a DO-NOT-OPERATE identifier on the selector.
Open the forward cargo compartment door, 821.
Remove the aft bulkhead lining of the forward cargo compartment (Ref. MM 25-50-03).
Locate the applicable Main Cargo Shutoff Valve about two feet to the left of the mix manifold.
Disconnect, cap, and stow the electrical connector.
Rotate the manual drive with 5/32-inch hexagonal wrench until the position indicator points to CLOSE.

note.para: About 15 turns are necessary to go from the full open to full closed position.

numlitem.para: Deactivate associated zone trim air modulating valve in the closed position (see 21-61-1-2 CABIN COMPT TEMP CONTROL SYSTEM).
If the forward riser shutoff valve is closed, close the trim air valve for the forward zone.
If the aft riser shutoff valve is closed, close the trim valve for the aft zone.
Install the aft bulkhead lining of the forward cargo compartment (Ref. MM 25-50-03).
Close the forward cargo compartment door, 821.
